TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON DATE , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by PERSON , Representative of GPE at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE the applicant found a burglar in his flat and caused him fatal injuries . On DATE he was arrested and remanded in custody , and on DATE he was charged with manslaughter .
On DATE the applicant requested that Mr PERSON , a privately retained lawyer , be admitted as a defence counsel .

On DATE the applicant challenged his detention before the GPE ORG of Kostroma . He also requested that Mr PERSON be admitted to the proceedings as defence counsel . On an unidentified date Mr PERSON was refused admission as defence counsel , apparently on the grounds that he had failed to submit proof that he was a member of a bar association .

On DATE the court examined the applicant ’s request for release , in proceedings at which the applicant was present in person and was assisted by PERSON , a legal aid counsel . The court upheld the applicant ’s pre - trial detention , having found that it was justified in view of the seriousness of the charge and the applicant ’s character . This decision could be appealed to ORG within DATE , but no cassation appeal was lodged .

On DATE the GPE ORG of GPE examined the charges against the applicant . The applicant was represented in the proceedings by PERSON . He was found guilty of causing grievous bodily harm and sentenced to CARDINAL years’ imprisonment .

On DATE Mr PERSON requested on the applicant ’s behalf an extension of the DATE time - limit for lodging an appeal against the judgment of DATE . On DATE the request was refused . No appeal was lodged against the refusal .

DATE and DATE the applicant was serving his sentence in ORG OT-CARDINAL/CARDINAL , a penitentiary facility in GPE . The parties submitted the following accounts of conditions in DATE , including health care and the prevention of tuberculosis .

The unit where the applicant was housed was shared by CARDINAL inmates . The diet was poor because the vegetable supply was limited to potatoes and beetroot . No medicines were available in the facility . During the applicant ’s imprisonment in GPE there was an outbreak of tuberculosis , and the applicant had fears of contracting tuberculosis himself . He claimed to have developed chronic bronchitis , but he submitted no medical evidence of it .
On the applicant ’s arrival in DATE he underwent a medical examination including an x - ray and clinical tests . He was found to be in good health .

He was placed in unit no . DATE , a dormitory which measured QUANTITY . m , including a sleeping area of CARDINAL sq . m , a storage room , canteen , common room , washroom and toilet . At the material time the dormitory housed CARDINAL inmates , which afforded them QUANTITY . m of personal space in the sleeping area , or QUANTITY . m in the whole unit including common areas . The catering in DATE conformed to the standard requirements . Inmates were provided with CARDINAL meals a day .

Persons infected with tuberculosis were placed separately from the rest and treated in a specialised section of the local hospital . At the material period no outbreak of tuberculosis was registered in GPE . Sanitary and epidemiological checks were conducted in the facility on a DATE basis . The reports for DATE indicated that there had been no infectious diseases registered in ORG in that period . There have always been sufficient supplies of medicines in the medical unit of DATE .

During his imprisonment the applicant consulted a doctor on a number of occasions , which were recorded as follows . On DATE he had a tooth removed by a dentist . On DATE he was diagnosed with acute bronchitis . He was given leave from work and underwent medical treatment . The applicant did not turn up for the second appointment with the doctor . On DATE he was diagnosed with furunculosis ( boils ) , for which he received treatment . On DATE and on DATE he was diagnosed with a common cold ; on both occasions he was given leave from work and underwent medical treatment .
The applicant underwent regular mandatory ORG examinations which took place on DATE , on DATE and on DATE and did not reveal any disease .
The Government submits that the applicant did not lodge any complaints concerning the conditions in OTCARDINAL/CARDINAL during his term of imprisonment or after release .
LAW CARDINAL of the Penitentiary Code of DATE provides for a minimum standard of QUANTITY of personal space for male convicts in correctional colonies .
